clinical_study.official_title: Physiotherapie Bei Chronischer Metatarsalgie - Ein Vergleich Klinischer Parameter Vor Und Nach Therapie gemäß Spiraldynamik®- Konzept

brief_summary.textblock: The pilot study was conducted in the form of an open prospective single-arm observational study with 28 patients who received physiotherapy at the Spiraldynamik® Med Center in Zurich.

detailed_description.textblock: The pilot study was conducted in the form of an open prospective single-arm observational study. The data of 28 patients who received physiotherapy at the Spiraldynamik® Med Center in Zurich was evaluated. The endpoints of Visual Analog Scale Foot and Ankle (VAS FA), Activity Index (AI), plantar and inter-metatarsal pres-sure pain, rearfoot angle and dorsal extension capability of the upper ankle joint were individually compared and analyzed before and after therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual Analog Scale Foot and Ankle (VAS FA)

secondary_outcome.measure: plantar and inter-metatarsal pressure pain - measured dichotom
secondary_outcome.description: measured dichotom - pain triggered or not
measured in degree, during standing: the angle for pes valgus (measured at the position of calcaneus)

secondary_outcome.measure: dorsal extension capability of the upper ankle joint measured in degree °

intervention.description: physiotherapeutic intervention according to the principles of the Spiraldynamik® concept

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- main diagnosis: Metatarsalgia
- secondary diagnosis: Hallux rigidus,Hallux valgus, Knick-Senk-Spreizfuß, Hohlfuß
- age 30-75 Jahre, gender both
- chronic ( ≥ 3 month),
- pain ≥ 1 visuell analog scale (VAS)
- no other complementary therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- local: trauma, fracture, tumore, infectionen
- pain after forefoot - operation
- neurological diseases
- generell: somatoform, pension covet
